summary: Internal email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing how to handle document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's defense team following his death. The requests, sent by attorney Michael C. Miller, are related to Epstein's death and are intended for the MCC, FBI, and SDNY.

events.title: Document Requests Following Epstein's Death
events.description: Epstein's defense team, via Michael C. Miller, sends document requests to the U.S. Attorney's Office, MCC, and FBI regarding Epstein's death, prompting internal discussion on how to handle them.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody; his defense team is seeking documents related to his death.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team is actively seeking documents from the U.S. Attorney's Office, MCC, and FBI regarding Epstein's death shortly after it occurred.
Internal emails show prosecutors uncertain about how to handle these posthumous document requests, considering referring them to the Civil Division.
The document references case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19-CRIM-00490 (S.D.N.Y.)', indicating the ongoing legal proceedings at the time of Epstein's death.
Attorney Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP is the point of contact for Epstein's defense team regarding these Touhy requests.
The emails highlight administrative and procedural challenges within the U.S. Attorney's Office following Epstein's death in custody.
